bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: How old was Francis when he would take up arms and fight in the Assisian army against Perugia?
What had impressed Francis since his youth about the knights that he saw walking around Assisi?
acceptableAnswers: Their fine leather gloves, boots and cloaks
distractors: Their loyalty to the church and pope
Their courage in battle and honor
Their noble lineage and family crests

questions.question: What kind of family business did Francis' father have?
questions.correctAnswer: A family business specializing in textiles
distractors: A banking and money lending operation
A farm producing wine and olive oil

questions.question: Why did the Minors hate the Rocca fortress?
acceptableAnswers: It represented centuries of tyrannical feudal rule
Oppressive taxes were levied against them there
distractors: It was built on sacred ground
It housed enemy soldiers from Perugia
It blocked access to the marketplace
It was where criminals were imprisoned

questions.question: Where did the Minors move the central government when they declared Assisi an independent commune?
questions.correctAnswer: To the square near the marketplace in the center of town
distractors: To the cathedral near the main church
To a newly built hall near the city gates
To the hillside overlooking the city

questions.question: Why did the Minors move the center of government?
questions.correctAnswer: To be closer to where the common people lived
distractors: To distance themselves from the church
To be nearer to trade routes

questions.question: What was the new economy based on, compared to previous generations where inherited land was the main source of wealth?
questions.correctAnswer: It was concentrated in cash and the marketplace

questions.question: What did Francis want more than both land or money?
distractors: To be a merchant like his father
To serve God as a priest

questions.question: Why was Pietro hopeful that Francis would make him proud in the battle between Assisi and Perugia?
questions.correctAnswer: He was hopeful he would return as a knight
distractors: He believed Francis would prove his business skills
He expected Francis would gain political influence
He thought Francis would capture valuable prisoners
He hoped Francis would win glory and wealth
He wanted Francis to show his military leadership

questions.question: What did Francis' father provide for him in preparation for the battle?
distractors: A sword and shield from France
Chain mail and provisions for the journey

questions.question: What was the call to arms in Assisi prior to the parade out of town towards the battle?
questions.correctAnswer: The ringing of the cathedral bells

questions.question: Who gave blessings to the army as they exited through the Portia Antica gate?
questions.correctAnswer: The monks of the Benedictine monastery of San Pietro

questions.question: What changed about the army's mood as they entered contested territory?
questions.correctAnswer: It went from jubilant enthusiasm to caution and vigilance
distractors: It went from fear to confidence and courage
It changed from solemnity to excitement
It shifted from unity to division
It moved from prayer to singing battle songs
It turned from discipline to chaos

questions.question: What happened when the Assisian Army was halfway across the St. John's Bridge?
distractors: They were met by a peace delegation
A storm forced them to turn back

questions.question: Did Francis become a knight after the battle? If not, what happened to him?
questions.correctAnswer: No, he was bound and taken to a Perugian prison where he would spend a full year
distractors: Yes, he was knighted on the battlefield for his bravery
No, he escaped and returned home in shame
No, he was seriously wounded and sent home to recover
Yes, but he refused the honor and became a monk
No, he died heroically in battle

questions.question: What allowed Francis to be freed from prison one year later and return home?
distractors: A peace treaty was signed between the cities
He escaped during a prison uprising
The Pope intervened on his behalf
He was exchanged for Perugian prisoners
